pr_title: Added an additional type field to JSON property beans

timeline.message:
Add getPropertyType to ABeanProperty - (Task #794)

- Add BeanPropertyType enum
- Add BeanPropertyTypeAdapter and test case
- Add getPropertyType to concrete beans
- Update test resources

---
Task #794: Add an additional type field to JSON beans

timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,46 @@
+/*******************************************************************************
+ * Copyright (c) 2020 German Aerospace Center (DLR), Simulation and Software Technology, Germany.
+ *
+ * This program and the accompanying materials are made available under the
+ * terms of the Eclipse Public License 2.0 which is available at
+ * http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-2.0.
+ *
+ * SPDX-License-Identifier: EPL-2.0
+ *******************************************************************************/
+package de.dlr.sc.virsat.model.concept.types.property;
+
+public enum BeanPropertyType {
+	BOOLEAN("boolean"),
+	STRING("string"),
+	INT("int"),
+	FLOAT("float"),
+	ENUM("enum"),
+	RESOURCE("resource"),
+	REFERENCE("reference"),
+	EREFERENCE("ereference"),
+	COMPOSED("composed");
+
+	private final String type;
+
+	BeanPropertyType(String type) {
+		this.type = type;
+	}
+
+	public String getType() {
+		return type;
+	}
+
+	/**
+	 * Get a BeanPropertyType from a String s
+	 * @param s String
+	 * @return the BeanPropertyType
+	 */
+	public static BeanPropertyType fromString(String s) {

timeline.bodyText: Same as above, maybe "typeName" instead of just "s" so the reader better knows what he should expect.

replies.bodyText: You are right that is a way better way to do it, i will change it 👍

replies.bodyText: That's actually not what I meant :) There is an Enum method valueOf(String) which returns enum value, similar to your fromString
replies.author: andriikovalov-dlr

replies.bodyText: I really didn't see the forest for the trees here. No it finally looks good to me, thanks :)
